reviewText: Really beautiful and erotic vampire movie ever! Sensual vampires, dance, music with black humors... can't wait to see more.
I couldn't watch it, not even as background noise while I tried to play a video game.

This is an erotic vampire comedy/spoof that has cheese and moves into the "so bad its good" realm. A 1,000 year old Chinese Vampire Aleta (Ange Maya) has a coven of daughters living in  Alhambra, California. The US government wants to employ her as a secret weapon while a Russian named Ivor Helsing (Garrett Brawith) wants to drive a stake through the "wampire's" heart so she won't prey on anymore "wirgins." He is aided by a psychic vampire detector (Laura Cotenescu) who he meets in a bar.

The acting was horribly bad and some of it was designed that way. Aleta had an odd Chinese-Romanian accent. Zachary Ryan Block who played Joerg Von Helsing in a rather lengthy flashback, was perhaps the worst of the lot and I laughed as he wailed over the death of his father. (Sorry for that plot spoiler.)

The film includes a cleavage cam at one point and breaks down into a split screen musical number at another. It was enjoyable for all the wrong reasons.

Guide: F-bomb, sex, brief FF, male rape, nudity ( Tina Tanzer, Megan Renee Kim, Beverly Swanson, and thank you C.J. Sindayen, Ange Maya )

Kick-ass campy fun low budget horror film - with a lot of naked vampires! Complete with flashbacks to ancient China (in Mandarin with English subtitles) and a song and dance number between Secret Service agents and sexy vampire minions. A real hoot!

Ange Maya added a little something extra to this horror comedy about an Asian vampire with a love for virgin blood.  The SecDef tries to do business with her and then finds it wasn't such a swift idea.  Plenty of bare ta-ta's.
This movie was made terrible. It was a movie that you laugh at due to the horrific acting jobs!
It was ok, but could have been much better. I love good vampire movies.

Without a doubt this is one of the most entertaining movies my wife and I have watched in the past few years. It has all the elements of a camp horror film: poor plotting, tortured acting, unsexy sex scenes, bad lighting and bad editing. Just when you think the movie will collapse on its own awfulness, they break into song. A brilliant move that had my wife and I laughing out loud. I even went back and replayed the song for her later. Make sure you read the IMDB bio of Ms Maya.
Movie is not in English. Extremely disappointed. Don't waste your money.
What a steaming pile of dogs***
A few women are topless only. A couple have aweful ugly fake breasts.
